title.rendered: AqualisBraemar shortlisted for Energy Transition award

content.rendered:
AqualisBraemar has been shortlisted for EIC’s Energy Transition Award in their annual EIC Awards. The award recognises companies that contribute or demonstrate the next wave of technologies, beyond wind and solar, that will deliver the 2050 net-zero carbon goals of the UK.

We are delighted that we have been recognised for placing sustainability and the energy transition at the centre of our group strategy. This year we announced our commitment to achieve 50% of group revenues coming from renewables or ESG-driven services by 2025, after publishing our ESG strategy in our 2019 annual report.

We have only started on this journey and are working on many initiatives that will deliver our objective of de-risking and driving the energy transition in energy and oceans through our AqualisBraemar business lines and group companies such as OWC. 

Read about our journey in EIC’s Survive and Thrive publication.

Due to the pandemic this year, the EIC awards will be virtual, and you can attend online. If you wish to know more about the awards or the online event, please click here.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar to acquire LOC Group
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar ASA has entered into an agreement to acquire 100 percent of the shares in LOC Group, thereby creating a leading global independent offshore energy and marine consultancy.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Acquisition of LOC Group completed
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar ASA has successfully completed the acquisition of 100 percent of the shares in LOC Group, thereby creating a leading global independent offshore energy and marine consultancy.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC reaches 50 GW milestone
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Following recent project awards in Taiwan, the US and the UK, OWC has reached the impressive milestone of being involved in more than 50 GW of offshore wind projects since the company’s inception in 2011.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Rodger Dickson considers the energy transition
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Rodger Dickson, our Group Managing Director of Offshore, considers the energy transition and looks ahead on what it may mean for our industry.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar supports UN Global Compact
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: By signalling this intent, AqualisBraemar commits to making the UN Global Compact, and its principles, part of the strategy, culture and day-to-day operations of the company, and to engage in collaborative projects which advance the broader development goals of the United Nations, particularly its sustainable development goals.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Q3 2020 financial results
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: “In line with normal seasonality, the third quarter of 2020 was less active than previous quarters. Regardless, the business continues to show growth and improved profitability relative to the same period last year.”
